title: Courbet and the Modern Landscape (Art Ebook Painting).pdf
description:
Mary Morton, Charlotte Eyerman, "Courbet and the Modern Landscape"
2006 | ISBN: 0892368365 | English | PDF | 152 pages | 18.05 Mb

While the large-scale figural works of Gustave CourbetÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s early to mid-careerÃ¢â‚¬â€pictures such as Burial at Ornans, The Stonebreakers, and The Studio of the PainterÃ¢â‚¬â€are of signal importance to the history of Western art, it is in the genre of landscape that the artist laid the groundwork for a vital current of Modernist painting. A young turk from the provinces who made his mark in Paris, he promoted his image as a gregarious outsider, passionate, physically robust, and profoundly ambitious. Drawing inspiration from natural motifs, Courbet reset the course of French painting to embrace immediacy, vitality, and painterly self-expression. 

Courbet and the Modern Landscape accompanies the first major museum exhibition to address the artistÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s extraordinary achievement in the genre of landscape painting. The book illustrates a highly selective group of landscapes from 1855 to 1877, most of them from the 1860s, when Courbet discovered in the countryside of his native Franche-ComtÃƒÂ© and on the shores of the Normandy coast a consistently rich source of visual stimulation. Many of the paintingsÃ¢â‚¬â€from collections in Belgium, France, Germany, Holland, Japan, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, and the United StatesÃ¢â‚¬â€will be new to general readers of art history, and their juxtaposition will be a revelation to both experts and amateurs alike.
